ground_truth: The LTD pulls to a stop at the end of the driveway leading to Beatrice's farmhouse, where the alien ship landed, and the wrecked pickup truck is still there. Jay and Kay get out, appearing as very undercover cops, and Jay starts up the driveway while Kay pulls a black card from his wallet and extends it to Beatrice as she draws close. Beatrice looks much better than before, more nicely dressed, with a touch of makeup and a smile on her face. In the living room, Jay sips some of her lemonade and winces as a little giggle escapes her at the thought. Kay is in the hole where the ship landed, investigating with a pocket spectral analyzer over a section of scorched earth, and above him, Jay leans over, staring down as Kay looks up at him and the analyzer shifts colors from red to yellow, then purple, and green. It's Dr. Laurel Weaver, the woman who tried to speak to Jay before. Laurel signs his clipboard, gives him a dirty look, but he laughs and leaves. She goes to the stretcher, bends down, and gently pets Rosenberg's cat. She looks up to see Jay and Kay standing there, then goes to the Arquillian's body on a table under the lights, throws back a sheet revealing the fully dissected Arquillian, and begins to examine it. Jay and Laurel cross the room to where Rosenberg's corpse lies on another gurney, and she snaps her rubber gloves and reaches down, sinking her hands into the body as she moves things aside, which by Jay's expression, is very disgusting. From the other side of the room, Kay clears his throat, and Jay walks across the morgue to Kay, who is still examining the Arquillian. Jay turns and races across the room to rejoin her, leans down, and notices strange stitching around the base of Rosenberg's ear. He reaches out, touches the ear, turns it, and with a soft pull, the ear comes away from the head like a latch. Jay pulls again, and Rosenberg's entire face pushes out with a mechanical hum and hinges open, the whole face rotating away from the rest of the artificial skull. A tiny little green man, gravely wounded but not quite dead, staggers up out of a small control room inside Rosenberg's head, with gearshifts and viewing screens all around the inside of the skull. The Baltian nods vigorously, nods again, falls, and dies. Kay and Jay are not paying attention to Laurel when FLASH! Without even looking at her, Kay whips out his neuralyzer and blanks her out.

test_cases.name: Synonym Substitution
test_cases.description: The LTD halts to a stop at the end of the driveway leading to Beatrice's farmhouse, where the extraterrestrial craft landed, and the wrecked pickup truck is still there. Jay and Kay disembark, appearing as very undercover officers, and Jay begins up the driveway while Kay pulls a black card from his wallet and extends it to Beatrice as she draws near. Beatrice appears much better than before, more nicely dressed, with a touch of cosmetics and a grin on her visage. In the living room, Jay sips some of her lemonade and winces as a little giggle escapes her at the thought. Kay is in the hole where the craft landed, investigating with a pocket spectral analyzer over a section of charred earth, and above him, Jay leans over, staring down as Kay looks up at him and the analyzer shifts hues from red to yellow, then purple, and green. It's Dr. Laurel Weaver, the woman who attempted to speak to Jay before. Laurel signs his clipboard, gives him a filthy look, but he chuckles and departs. She goes to the stretcher, bends down, and gently strokes Rosenberg's feline. She glances up to see Jay and Kay standing there, then goes to the Arquillian's body on a table under the lights, throws back a sheet revealing the fully dissected Arquillian, and begins to scrutinize it. Jay and Laurel cross the room to where Rosenberg's cadaver lies on another gurney, and she snaps her rubber gloves and reaches down, plunging her hands into the body as she rearranges things, which by Jay's expression, is very nauseating. From the other side of the room, Kay clears his throat, and Jay walks across the morgue to Kay, who is still examining the Arquillian. Jay turns and dashes across the room to rejoin her, leans down, and observes strange stitching around the base of Rosenberg's ear. He reaches out, touches the ear, turns it, and with a soft pull, the ear comes away from the head like a latch. Jay pulls again, and Rosenberg's entire visage pushes out with a mechanical hum and hinges open, the whole face rotating away from the rest of the artificial skull. A tiny little green man, gravely injured but not quite deceased, staggers up out of a small control room inside Rosenberg's head, with gearshifts and viewing screens all around the interior of the skull. The Baltian nods vigorously, nods again, collapses, and perishes. Kay and Jay are not paying attention to Laurel when FLASH! Without even glancing at her, Kay whips out his neuralyzer and blanks her out.

test_cases.name: Active <-> Passive Transformation
test_cases.description: The LTD is pulled to a stop at the end of the driveway leading to Beatrice's farmhouse, where the alien ship has landed, and the wrecked pickup truck remains. Jay and Kay get out, appearing as very undercover cops, and the driveway is started up by Jay while a black card is pulled from his wallet by Kay and extended to Beatrice as she draws close. Beatrice is looked at, much better than before, more nicely dressed, with a touch of makeup and a smile on her face. In the living room, some of her lemonade is sipped by Jay, who winces as a little giggle escapes her at the thought. In the hole where the ship landed, Kay is investigating with a pocket spectral analyzer over a section of scorched earth, and above him, Jay leans over, staring down as Kay looks up at him and the analyzer shifts colors from red to yellow, then purple, and green. It's Dr. Laurel Weaver, the woman who tried to speak to Jay before. The clipboard is signed by Laurel, who gives him a dirty look, but he laughs and leaves. She goes to the stretcher, bends down, and Rosenberg's cat is gently petted by her. She looks up to see Jay and Kay standing there, then goes to the Arquillian's body on a table under the lights, throws back a sheet that reveals the fully dissected Arquillian, and begins to examine it. The room is crossed by Jay and Laurel to where Rosenberg's corpse lies on another gurney, and her rubber gloves are snapped by her as she reaches down, sinking her hands into the body and moving things aside, which by Jay's expression, is very disgusting. From the other side of the room, his throat is cleared by Kay, and Jay walks across the morgue to Kay, who is still examining the Arquillian. Jay turns and races across the room to rejoin her, leans down, and notices strange stitching around the base of Rosenberg's ear. The ear is reached out to, touched, and turned by him, and with a soft pull, the ear is removed from the head like a latch. Jay pulls again, and Rosenberg's entire face is pushed out with a mechanical hum and hinges open, the whole face rotating away from the rest of the artificial skull. A tiny little green man, gravely wounded but not quite dead, staggers up out of a small control room inside Rosenberg's head, with gearshifts and viewing screens all around the inside of the skull. The Baltian nods vigorously, nods again, falls, and dies. Laurel is not being paid attention to by Kay and Jay when FLASH! Without even looking at her, the neuralyzer is whipped out by Kay and she is blanked out.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: The LTD stops at the end of Beatrice's driveway, where the alien ship landed and the wrecked pickup remains. Jay and Kay, looking like undercover cops, exit the car. Kay hands Beatrice a black card as Jay heads up the driveway. Beatrice appears better, nicely dressed with makeup and a smile. In the living room, Jay sips lemonade, wincing as she giggles. Kay investigates the ship's landing site with a spectral analyzer, which changes colors. Dr. Laurel Weaver, who previously tried to speak to Jay, signs his clipboard, glares, and leaves. She pets Rosenberg's cat, then examines the dissected Arquillian under lights. Jay and Laurel move to Rosenberg's corpse, where she disgustingly reaches inside. Kay clears his throat, prompting Jay to join him at the Arquillian. Jay notices stitching around Rosenberg's ear, pulls it, and the face opens mechanically, revealing a tiny, wounded green man inside the skull's control room. The Baltian nods, falls, and dies. Kay and Jay ignore Laurel when FLASH! Kay neuralyzes her without looking.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: The LTD stops at Beatrice's farmhouse, where the alien ship landed and the wrecked pickup remains. Jay and Kay, looking like undercover cops, exit. Kay hands Beatrice a black card as Jay walks up the driveway. Beatrice, now well-dressed and smiling, watches. Inside, Jay sips lemonade, wincing as Kay investigates the scorched earth with a spectral analyzer, which changes colors. Dr. Laurel Weaver, who previously tried to speak to Jay, signs his clipboard, glares, and leaves. She pets Rosenberg's cat, then examines the dissected Arquillian under lights. Jay and Laurel approach Rosenberg's corpse, and she disgustingly reaches into the body. Kay clears his throat, and Jay joins him at the Arquillian. Jay notices stitching on Rosenberg's ear, pulls it, and the face opens mechanically, revealing a tiny, wounded green man inside the skull. The Baltian nods, falls, and dies. Kay and Jay ignore Laurel when FLASH! Kay neuralyzes her without looking.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description:
The LTD comes to a complete stop at the very end of the long driveway that leads directly to Beatrice's quaint farmhouse, the very location where the alien ship made its unexpected landing, and where the wrecked pickup truck still remains as a testament to the event. Jay and Kay step out of the vehicle, exuding the appearance of highly undercover cops, and Jay begins his walk up the driveway. Meanwhile, Kay retrieves a sleek black card from his wallet and extends it toward Beatrice as she approaches them. Beatrice, now looking significantly better than before, is more nicely dressed, with a touch of makeup enhancing her features and a smile brightening her face. Inside the cozy living room, Jay takes a sip of her refreshing lemonade and winces slightly as a small giggle escapes her at the amusing thought. Kay, on the other hand, is in the hole where the alien ship landed, diligently investigating with a pocket spectral analyzer over a section of the scorched earth. Above him, Jay leans over, peering down as Kay looks up at him, and the analyzer shifts its colors from red to yellow, then to purple, and finally to green. 

It's Dr. Laurel Weaver, the woman who had previously attempted to speak with Jay. Laurel signs his clipboard, gives him a dirty look, but he merely laughs it off and leaves. She then moves to the stretcher, bends down, and gently pets Rosenberg's cat. As she looks up, she notices Jay and Kay standing there, and then she proceeds to the table under the bright lights where the Arquillian's body lies. She throws back a sheet, revealing the fully dissected Arquillian, and begins her examination. Jay and Laurel cross the room to where Rosenberg's corpse is laid out on another gurney. She snaps on her rubber gloves and reaches down, sinking her hands into the body as she moves things aside, which, judging by Jay's expression, is quite disgusting. From across the room, Kay clears his throat, prompting Jay to walk over to him, where Kay is still examining the Arquillian. Jay then turns and races back across the room to rejoin her, leans down, and notices some strange stitching around the base of Rosenberg's ear. He reaches out, touches the ear, turns it slightly, and with a gentle pull, the ear detaches from the head like a latch. Jay pulls again, and Rosenberg's entire face pushes out with a mechanical hum, hinging open as the whole face rotates away from the rest of the artificial skull. A tiny little green man, gravely wounded but not quite dead, staggers up from a small control room inside Rosenberg's head, surrounded by gearshifts and viewing screens all around the interior of the skull. The Baltian nods vigorously, nods once more, then falls and dies. Kay and Jay are not paying attention to Laurel when FLASH! Without even glancing at her, Kay swiftly whips out his neuralyzer and erases her memory.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description:
The LTD, a sleek and classic vehicle, comes to a complete and utter stop at the very end of the long, winding driveway that leads directly to Beatrice's quaint and charming farmhouse. This is the very location where the alien ship made its unexpected and dramatic landing, and it is also where the wrecked pickup truck still stands as a testament to the extraordinary event that occurred. Jay and Kay step out of the vehicle with a certain flair, exuding the appearance of highly undercover cops on a mission. Jay begins his determined walk up the driveway, while Kay reaches into his wallet to retrieve a sleek black card. He extends it toward Beatrice, who is approaching them with curiosity. Beatrice, now looking significantly better than she did before, is more nicely dressed, with a touch of makeup enhancing her features, and a bright smile illuminating her face. 

Inside the cozy and inviting living room, Jay takes a sip of her refreshing homemade lemonade and winces slightly as a small giggle escapes her. The amusing thought clearly brings a twinkle to her eyes. Kay, on the other hand, is in the hole where the alien ship made its landing. He is diligently investigating the area with a pocket spectral analyzer, scanning over a section of the scorched earth. Above him, Jay leans over, peering down with curiosity as Kay looks up at him. The spectral analyzer shifts its colors dramatically from red to yellow, then to purple, and finally settles on green. 

It's Dr. Laurel Weaver, the intelligent woman who had previously attempted to engage Jay in conversation. Laurel signs his clipboard with a flourish, gives him a dirty look filled with disdain, but he simply laughs it off and leaves the scene. She then moves gracefully to the stretcher, bends down gently, and pets Rosenberg's cat with care. As she looks up, she notices Jay and Kay standing there, observing intently, and then she proceeds to the table under the bright, clinical lights where the Arquillian's body lies in state. She throws back a crisp white sheet, revealing the fully dissected Arquillian, and begins her thorough examination. 

Jay and Laurel make their way across the room to where Rosenberg's lifeless corpse is laid out on another gurney, positioned with precision. She snaps on her rubber gloves with a decisive motion and reaches down, sinking her hands into the body as she carefully moves things aside. Judging by Jay's expression, the scene is quite disgusting and almost unbearable. From across the room, Kay clears his throat with purpose, prompting Jay to walk over to him, where Kay is still meticulously examining the Arquillian. Jay then turns and races back across the room to rejoin Laurel. He leans down and notices some strange stitching around the base of Rosenberg's ear. He reaches out with curiosity, touches the ear, turns it slightly, and with a gentle pull, the ear detaches from the head like a cleverly concealed latch. Jay pulls again, and Rosenberg's entire face pushes out with a soft mechanical hum, hinging open as the whole face rotates away from the rest of the artificial skull. Inside, a tiny little green man, gravely wounded but clinging to life, staggers up from a small control room within Rosenberg's head. The room is surrounded by gearshifts and viewing screens, strategically arranged all around the interior of the skull. The Baltian nods vigorously, nods once more in an urgent manner, then collapses and succumbs to his injuries. Kay and Jay are not paying attention to Laurel at that moment when FLASH! Without even glancing at her, Kay swiftly whips out his neuralyzer and erases her memory with practiced ease.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: The LTD gradually slows down and comes to a complete stop at the end of the driveway leading to Beatrice's farmhouse, a location marked by the presence of the alien ship and the wrecked pickup truck still visible. Jay and Kay exit the vehicle, their appearance unmistakably that of very undercover cops, and Jay begins his walk up the driveway. Meanwhile, Kay retrieves a black card from his wallet, extending it towards Beatrice as she approaches them. Beatrice, now looking significantly better than before, is more nicely dressed, with a touch of makeup enhancing her features and a smile brightening her face. Inside the living room, Jay takes a sip of her lemonade, and as the tartness hits his taste buds, he winces slightly, prompting a little giggle from Beatrice at the amusing sight. Outside, Kay is positioned in the hole where the alien ship landed, meticulously investigating the area with a pocket spectral analyzer over a section of scorched earth. Above him, Jay leans over, peering down with curiosity as Kay looks up, and they both observe the analyzer's display shifting colors from red to yellow, then purple, and finally green. Dr. Laurel Weaver, the woman who previously attempted to speak with Jay, enters the scene, signing his clipboard and casting a dirty look his way, to which he responds with a laugh before departing. Laurel then approaches the stretcher, bends down, and gently pets Rosenberg's cat, offering a moment of tenderness. She looks up to find Jay and Kay standing there, prompting her to move to the table under the lights where the Arquillian's body lies. She throws back the sheet, revealing the fully dissected Arquillian, and begins her examination. Jay and Laurel cross the room to where Rosenberg's corpse rests on another gurney. Laurel snaps on her rubber gloves and reaches down, her hands delving into the body as she moves things aside, an action that visibly disgusts Jay. From across the room, Kay clears his throat, prompting Jay to walk over to him, where Kay continues his examination of the Arquillian. Jay then turns and quickly races back across the room to rejoin Laurel, leaning down to notice strange stitching around the base of Rosenberg's ear. He reaches out, touches the ear, and with a gentle turn and soft pull, the ear detaches from the head like a latch. Jay pulls again, and with a mechanical hum, Rosenberg's entire face rotates away from the rest of the artificial skull, revealing a tiny green man inside. Gravely wounded but not quite dead, the little Baltian staggers up from a small control room within Rosenberg's head, surrounded by gearshifts and viewing screens. The Baltian nods vigorously, nods once more, then collapses and dies. Meanwhile, Kay and Jay, not paying attention to Laurel, are suddenly interrupted when FLASH! Without even glancing at her, Kay swiftly retrieves his neuralyzer and erases her memory.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description:
The LTD stops at the end of the driveway to Beatrice's farmhouse, where the alien ship landed and the wrecked pickup truck remains. Jay and Kay, appearing as undercover cops, exit the car. Jay heads up the driveway while Kay hands Beatrice a black card from his wallet. Beatrice, now looking better with makeup and a smile, welcomes them. Inside, Jay sips her lemonade, wincing slightly, while Kay investigates the ship's landing site with a spectral analyzer, which changes colors as Jay observes from above.

Dr. Laurel Weaver, who previously tried to speak to Jay, signs his clipboard with a dirty look before tending to Rosenberg's cat. She then examines the dissected Arquillian body under the lights. Jay and Laurel move to Rosenberg's corpse, where she snaps on rubber gloves and begins a gruesome examination, much to Jay's disgust. Kay clears his throat, prompting Jay to join him at the Arquillian's body. Jay notices strange stitching around Rosenberg's ear, touches it, and discovers it functions as a latch. With a pull, Rosenberg's face opens mechanically, revealing a tiny, gravely wounded green man inside a control room within the skull. The Baltian nods vigorously before collapsing and dying. As Laurel is distracted, Kay swiftly uses his neuralyzer to erase her memory without even looking at her.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: The LTD, a model of car known for its durability and used frequently by police departments in the 1980s, pulls to a stop at the end of the driveway leading to Beatrice's farmhouse, a typical rural American home complete with a red barn and fields stretching to the horizon, where the alien ship landed, and the wrecked pickup truck, a remnant of the incident caused by the extraterrestrial disturbance, is still there. Jay and Kay get out, appearing as very undercover cops working for a secretive government agency that deals with extraterrestrial matters, and Jay starts up the driveway while Kay pulls a black card, marked with the insignia of the Men in Black organization, from his wallet and extends it to Beatrice as she draws close. Beatrice looks much better than before, more nicely dressed, with a touch of makeup and a smile on her face, suggesting perhaps new hope or a bribe. In the living room, Jay sips some of her lemonade, a classic homemade drink in these rural areas, and winces as a little giggle escapes her at the thought. Kay is in the hole where the ship, now a part of local folklore, landed, investigating with a pocket spectral analyzer, a device designed to detect energy signatures, over a section of scorched earth, and above him, Jay leans over, staring down as Kay looks up at him and the analyzer shifts colors from red to yellow, then purple, and green, indicating the presence of multiple alien elements. It's Dr. Laurel Weaver, the former forensic pathologist who tried to speak to Jay before. Laurel signs his clipboard, which is standard procedure for documenting autopsies, gives him a dirty look, but he laughs and leaves. She goes to the stretcher, bends down, and gently pets Rosenberg's cat, which has been unusually calm despite the chaos, indicative of its extraterrestrial origin. She looks up to see Jay and Kay standing there, then goes to the Arquillian's body on a table under the lights, throws back a sheet revealing the fully dissected Arquillian, a species known for its delicate political ties to Earth, and begins to examine it. Jay and Laurel cross the room to where Rosenberg's corpse, known as a respected jeweler in New York City who secretly brokered peace between alien factions, lies on another gurney, and she snaps her rubber gloves and reaches down, sinking her hands into the body as she moves things aside, which by Jay's expression, is very disgusting. From the other side of the room, Kay clears his throat, and Jay walks across the morgue to Kay, who is still examining the Arquillian. Jay turns and races across the room to rejoin her, leans down, and notices strange stitching around the base of Rosenberg's ear, a subtle hint of advanced alien technology. He reaches out, touches the ear, turns it, and with a soft pull, the ear comes away from the head like a latch. Jay pulls again, and Rosenberg's entire face pushes out with a mechanical hum, a hallmark of synthetic humanoid constructs, and hinges open, the whole face rotating away from the rest of the artificial skull. A tiny little green man, the last of the Baltian diplomats, gravely wounded but not quite dead, staggers up out of a small control room inside Rosenberg's head, with gearshifts and viewing screens all around the inside of the skull. The Baltian nods vigorously, nods again, falls, and dies, marking the end of an era of peace talks. Kay and Jay are not paying attention to Laurel when FLASH! Without even looking at her, Kay whips out his neuralyzer, a device that erases short-term memory, and blanks her out.

In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. A tiny little green man gravely wounded but not quite dead staggers up out of a small control room inside Rosenberg's head with gearshifts and viewing screens all around the inside of the skull. The Baltian nods vigorously nods again falls and dies. Kay and Jay are not paying attention to Laurel when FLASH. Without even looking at her Kay whips out his neuralyzer and blanks her out.

Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. Jay and Laurel cross the room to where Rosenberg's corpse lies on another gurney and she snaps her rubber gloves and reaches down sinking her hands into the body as she moves things aside which by Jay's expression is very disgusting. From the other side of the room Kay clears his throat and Jay walks across the morgue to Kay who is still examining the Arquillian. Jay turns and races across the room to rejoin her leans down and notices strange stitching around the base of Rosenberg's ear. He reaches out touches the ear turns it and with a soft pull the ear comes away from the head like a latch. Jay pulls again and Rosenberg's entire face pushes out with a mechanical hum and hinges open the whole face rotating away from the rest of the artificial skull. A tiny little green man gravely wounded but not quite dead staggers up out of a small control room inside Rosenberg's head with gearshifts and viewing screens all around the inside of the skull. The Baltian nods vigorously nods again falls and dies. Kay and Jay are not paying attention to Laurel when FLASH. Without even looking at her Kay whips out his neuralyzer and blanks her out.

test_cases.name: Deletion (~50%)
test_cases.description: The LTD pulls to a stop at the end of the driveway leading to Beatrice's farmhouse where the alien ship landed and the wrecked pickup truck is still there. Jay and Kay get out appearing as very undercover cops and Jay starts up the driveway while Kay pulls a black card from his wallet and extends it to Beatrice as she draws close. Beatrice looks much better than before more nicely dressed with a touch of makeup and a smile on her face. In the living room Jay sips some of her lemonade and winces as a little giggle escapes her at the thought. Kay is in the hole where the ship landed investigating with a pocket spectral analyzer over a section of scorched earth and above him. A tiny little green man gravely wounded but not quite dead staggers up out of a small control room inside Rosenberg's head with gearshifts and viewing screens all around the inside of the skull. The Baltian nods vigorously nods again falls and dies. Kay and Jay are not paying attention to Laurel when FLASH. Without even looking at her Kay whips out his neuralyzer and blanks her out.

test_cases.name: Deletion (~80%)
test_cases.description: The LTD pulls to a stop at the end of the driveway leading to Beatrice's farmhouse where the alien ship landed and the wrecked pickup truck is still there. Jay and Kay get out appearing as very undercover cops and Jay starts up the driveway while Kay pulls a black card from his wallet and extends it to Beatrice as she draws close. Kay and Jay are not paying attention to Laurel when FLASH. Without even looking at her Kay whips out his neuralyzer and blanks her out.

test_cases.name: Subject Corruption
test_cases.description: The giraffe pulls to a stop at the end of the driveway leading to Beatrice's farmhouse, where the spaceship landed, and the wrecked pickup truck is still there. The rabbit and the snake get out, appearing as very undercover cops, and the rabbit starts up the driveway while the snake pulls a black card from his wallet and extends it to Beatrice as she draws close. Beatrice looks much better than before, more nicely dressed, with a touch of makeup and a smile on her face. In the living room, the rabbit sips some of her lemonade and winces as a little giggle escapes her at the thought. The snake is in the hole where the ship landed, investigating with a pocket spectral analyzer over a section of scorched earth, and above him, the rabbit leans over, staring down as the snake looks up at him and the analyzer shifts colors from red to yellow, then purple, and green. It's the pelican, the woman who tried to speak to the rabbit before. The pelican signs his clipboard, gives him a dirty look, but he laughs and leaves. She goes to the stretcher, bends down, and gently pets Rosenberg's cat. She looks up to see the rabbit and the snake standing there, then goes to the Arquillian's body on a table under the lights, throws back a sheet revealing the fully dissected Arquillian, and begins to examine it. The rabbit and the pelican cross the room to where Rosenberg's corpse lies on another gurney, and she snaps her rubber gloves and reaches down, sinking her hands into the body as she moves things aside, which by the rabbit's expression, is very disgusting. From the other side of the room, the snake clears his throat, and the rabbit walks across the morgue to the snake, who is still examining the Arquillian. The rabbit turns and races across the room to rejoin her, leans down, and notices strange stitching around the base of Rosenberg's ear. He reaches out, touches the ear, turns it, and with a soft pull, the ear comes away from the head like a latch. The rabbit pulls again, and Rosenberg's entire face pushes out with a mechanical hum and hinges open, the whole face rotating away from the rest of the artificial skull. A tiny little green man, gravely wounded but not quite dead, staggers up out of a small control room inside Rosenberg's head, with gearshifts and viewing screens all around the inside of the skull. The panda nods vigorously, nods again, falls, and dies. The snake and the rabbit are not paying attention to the pelican when FLASH! Without even looking at her, the snake whips out his neuralyzer and blanks her out.

test_cases.name: Object Corruption
test_cases.description: The SUV pulls to a stop at the end of the pathway leading to Beatrice's cabin, where the pirate ship landed, and the abandoned bicycle is still there. Jay and Kay get out, appearing as very undercover agents, and Jay starts up the pathway while Kay pulls a golden ticket from his wallet and extends it to Beatrice as she draws close. Beatrice looks much better than before, more nicely dressed, with a touch of makeup and a smile on her face. In the parlor, Jay sips some of her iced tea and winces as a little chuckle escapes her at the thought. Kay is in the pit where the ship landed, investigating with a handheld radiation detector over a section of charred grass, and above him, Jay leans over, staring down as Kay looks up at him and the detector shifts colors from blue to orange, then pink, and turquoise. It's Dr. Laurel Weaver, the woman who tried to speak to Jay before. Laurel signs his notepad, gives him a dirty look, but he laughs and leaves. She goes to the wheelchair, bends down, and gently pets Rosenberg's rabbit. She looks up to see Jay and Kay standing there, then goes to the Martian's body on a counter under the lamps, throws back a towel revealing the fully dissected Martian, and begins to examine it. Jay and Laurel cross the room to where Rosenberg's statue lies on another bench, and she snaps her rubber gloves and reaches down, sinking her hands into the body as she moves things aside, which by Jay's expression, is very disgusting. From the other side of the room, Kay clears his throat, and Jay walks across the laboratory to Kay, who is still examining the Martian. Jay turns and races across the room to rejoin her, leans down, and notices strange stitching around the base of Rosenberg's collar. He reaches out, touches the collar, turns it, and with a soft pull, the collar comes away from the neck like a latch. Jay pulls again, and Rosenberg's entire face pushes out with a mechanical hum and hinges open, the whole face rotating away from the rest of the artificial torso. A tiny little blue woman, gravely wounded but not quite dead, staggers up out of a small control room inside Rosenberg's chest, with gearshifts and viewing screens all around the inside of the torso. The Saturnian nods vigorously, nods again, falls, and dies. Kay and Jay are not paying attention to Laurel when FLASH! Without even looking at her, Kay whips out his eraser and blanks her out.

test_cases.name: Action Corruption
test_cases.description: The LTD glides to a halt at the end of the driveway leading to Beatrice's farmhouse, where the alien ship evaporated, and the wrecked pickup truck is still there. Jay and Kay step out, resembling very undercover agents, and Jay strolls up the driveway while Kay extracts a black card from his wallet and hands it to Beatrice as she approaches. Beatrice looks much better than before, more elegantly dressed, with a hint of makeup and a grin on her face. In the living room, Jay inhales some of her lemonade and grimaces as a little chuckle escapes her at the thought. Kay is in the pit where the ship evaporated, exploring with a pocket spectral analyzer over a patch of scorched earth, and above him, Jay perches over, gazing down as Kay glances up at him and the analyzer transitions colors from red to yellow, then purple, and green. It's Dr. Laurel Weaver, the woman who attempted to converse with Jay before. Laurel marks his clipboard, casts him a dirty look, but he chuckles and meanders away. She approaches the stretcher, kneels down, and softly strokes Rosenberg's cat. She glances up to see Jay and Kay standing there, then moves to the Arquillian's body on a table under the lights, pulls back a sheet uncovering the completely dissected Arquillian, and starts to inspect it. Jay and Laurel navigate the room to where Rosenberg's corpse rests on another gurney, and she snaps her rubber gloves and reaches down, embedding her hands into the body as she shifts things aside, which by Jay's expression, is very unpleasant. From the other side of the room, Kay clears his throat, and Jay strides across the morgue to Kay, who is still inspecting the Arquillian. Jay rotates and dashes across the room to rejoin her, bends down, and observes unusual stitching around the base of Rosenberg's ear. He extends his hand, taps the ear, swivels it, and with a gentle tug, the ear detaches from the head like a latch. Jay pulls again, and Rosenberg's entire face glides out with a mechanical hum and pivots open, the whole face revolving away from the rest of the artificial skull. A tiny little green man, severely injured but not quite dead, totters up out of a small control room inside Rosenberg's head, with gearshifts and viewing screens all around the inside of the skull. The Baltian shakes his head vigorously, shakes again, collapses, and expires. Kay and Jay are not paying heed to Laurel when FLASH! Without even glancing at her, Kay pulls out his neuralyzer and blanks her out.

test_cases.name: Subject-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: The teapot skids to a stop at the end of the racetrack leading to Olivia's igloo, where the enchanted castle landed, and the demolished skateboard is still there. Max and Sam get out, appearing as very undercover astronauts, and Max starts up the racetrack while Sam pulls a red envelope from his backpack and extends it to Olivia as she draws close. Olivia looks much healthier than before, more elegantly dressed, with a touch of frosting and a smirk on her elbow. In the garden, Max sips some of her soup and winces as a little whistle escapes her at the thought. Sam is in the burrow where the castle landed, analyzing with a pocket light saber over a section of scorched sand, and above him, Max leans over, staring down as Sam looks up at him and the light saber shifts colors from blue to orange, then pink, and turquoise. It's Professor Lucy Blue, the turtle who tried to sing to Max before. Lucy signs his calendar, gives him a confused look, but he chuckles and departs. She goes to the hammock, bends down, and gently pets Bromley's hat. She looks up to see Max and Sam standing there, then goes to the Zarkonian's helmet on a shelf under the desk lamp, throws back a blanket revealing the fully painted Zarkonian, and begins to analyze it. Max and Lucy cross the room to where Bromley's hat lies on another counter, and she snaps her rubber rings and reaches down, sinking her hands into the hat as she moves things aside, which by Max's expression, is very amusing. From the other side of the room, Sam clears his throat, and Max walks across the museum to Sam, who is still analyzing the Zarkonian. Max turns and races across the room to rejoin her, leans down, and notices strange glitter around the base of Bromley's shoelace. He reaches out, touches the shoelace, turns it, and with a soft pull, the shoelace comes away from the sneaker like a button. Max pulls again, and Bromley's entire face pushes out with a metallic whistle and hinges open, the whole face rotating away from the rest of the artificial boot. A tiny little orange lizard, gravely perplexed but not quite conscious, wobbles up out of a small control panel inside Bromley's shoe, with levers and viewing lenses all around the inside of the boot. The Kiwi nods enthusiastically, nods again, falls, and faints. Sam and Max are not paying attention to Lucy when GLIMMER! Without even looking at her, Sam whips out his saxophone and serenades her out.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action Corruption
test_cases.description: The train screeches to a halt at the end of the driveway leading to Beatrice's greenhouse, where the unicorn carriage docked, and the abandoned canoe is still there. Nora and Sam hop out, appearing as very undercover detectives, and Nora skips up the driveway while Sam pulls a blue card from his pocket and hands it to Beatrice as she approaches. Beatrice looks much different than before, more casually dressed, with a splash of glitter and a grin on her face. In the living room, Nora nibbles some of her cookies and grimaces as a little chuckle escapes her at the notion. Sam is in the pit where the carriage docked, exploring with a pocket magnetic scanner over a patch of scorched earth, and above him, Nora crouches, peering down as Sam glances up at her and the scanner oscillates colors from red to blue, then orange, and pink. It's Dr. Fiona Brock, the woman who attempted to talk to Nora earlier. Fiona initials her clipboard, shoots him a stern glance, but he snickers and departs. She approaches the cot, kneels down, and softly strokes Rosenberg's dog. She peers up to see Nora and Sam standing there, then strides to the Martian’s body on a counter beneath the lights, flips back a cloth exposing the thoroughly dissected Martian, and commences to scrutinize it. Nora and Fiona cross the space to where Rosenberg's remains rest on another stretcher, and she snaps her plastic gloves and reaches down, plunging her hands into the body as she rearranges things, which by Nora's expression, is exceedingly repulsive. From the opposite side of the room, Sam clears his throat, and Nora strolls across the morgue to Sam, who is still scrutinizing the Martian. Nora pivots and dashes across the room to join her, bends down, and observes peculiar stitching along the edge of Rosenberg's neck. She reaches out, touches the neck, twists it, and with a gentle tug, the neck detaches from the torso like a clasp. Nora tugs again, and Rosenberg's entire countenance pivots out with a mechanical hum and swings open, the whole face rotating away from the remainder of the synthetic skull. A minuscule blue creature, severely injured but not quite expired, lurches up out of a compact command center inside Rosenberg's head, with levers and display screens all around the interior of the skull. The Venusian nods eagerly, nods again, collapses, and perishes. Sam and Nora are not aware of Fiona when FLASH! Without even glancing at her, Sam brandishes his eraser and erases her memory.

test_cases.name: Object-Action Corruption
test_cases.description: The LTD drifts to a halt at the edge of the path leading to Beatrice's cabin, where the alien raft floated, and the demolished bicycle is still there. Jay and Kay climb out, appearing as very undercover agents, and Jay begins up the path while Kay extracts a blue ticket from his satchel and offers it to Beatrice as she approaches. Beatrice looks much healthier than before, more elegantly dressed, with a hint of glitter and a grin on her face. In the kitchen, Jay nibbles on some of her cookies and shudders as a little chuckle escapes her at the thought. Kay is in the pit where the raft floated, examining with a handheld compass over a patch of charred grass, and above him, Jay hovers over, gazing down as Kay glances up at him and the compass shifts hues from blue to orange, then pink, and teal. It's Dr. Laurel Weaver, the woman who tried to speak to Jay before. Laurel scribbles on his notepad, gives him a stern glance, but he chuckles and departs. She moves to the mat, crouches down, and softly strokes Rosenberg's rabbit. She glances up to see Jay and Kay standing there, then moves to the Arquillian's form on a counter under the lamps, pulls back a cloth revealing the entirely opened Arquillian, and starts to investigate it. Jay and Laurel cross the space to where Rosenberg's remains lie on another bed, and she adjusts her rubber mitts and reaches down, delving her hands into the form as she rearranges things, which, by Jay's expression, is quite revolting. From across the space, Kay clears his throat, and Jay strides across the lab to Kay, who is still scrutinizing the Arquillian. Jay turns and dashes across the space to rejoin her, bends down, and observes peculiar stitching around the base of Rosenberg's neck. He extends his hand, taps the neck, twists it, and with a gentle tug, the neck detaches from the frame like a clasp. Jay tugs once more, and Rosenberg's entire visage shifts out with a mechanical whir and swings apart, the entire face rotating away from the rest of the contrived cranium. A tiny little blue creature, seriously harmed but not quite lifeless, struggles up out of a small cabin inside Rosenberg's head, with levers and display panels all around the interior of the cranium. The Gorgon nods energetically, nods again, collapses, and perishes. Kay and Jay are not paying attention to Laurel when FLASH! Without even glancing at her, Kay whips out his flashlight and blanks her out.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: The rhinoceros rolls to a halt at the base of the escalator leading to Fiona's lighthouse, where the pirate ship docked, and the damaged scooter is still present. Max and Leo hop out, appearing as rather obvious lifeguards, and Max prances up the escalator while Leo fishes a purple feather from his satchel and presents it to Fiona as she drifts near. Fiona appears much happier than before, splendidly dressed, with a touch of glitter and a grin on her lips. In the workshop, Max slurps some of her iced tea and grimaces as a small chuckle slips past her at the notion. Leo is in the crater where the ship docked, inspecting with a handheld kaleidoscope over a patch of singed sand, and above him, Max peers over, gazing down as Leo glances up at him and the kaleidoscope changes hues from blue to orange, then pink, and teal. It's Dr. Clara Sands, the lady who attempted to sing to Max earlier. Clara sketches on his notepad, shoots him a scornful glare, but he chuckles and departs. She approaches the hammock, leans over, and tenderly strokes Galileo's dog. She glances up to spot Max and Leo standing there, then heads to the Martian's torso on a counter beneath the lamps, flips back a quilt revealing the fully unraveled Martian, and starts to scrutinize it. Max and Clara wander across the space to where Galileo's dummy rests on another dais, and she flicks her velvet mitts and bends down, plunging her fingers into the dummy as she shifts items aside, which by Max's expression, is quite revolting. From across the chamber, Leo clears his nose, and Max strolls across the pantry to Leo, who is still scrutinizing the Martian. Max pivots and sprints across the area to reunite with her, leans down, and notices peculiar threading around the edge of Galileo's shoe. He stretches out, prods the shoe, rotates it, and with a gentle tug, the shoe detaches from the foot like a clasp. Max pulls once more, and Galileo's entire visage ejects with a robotic whirr and pivots open, the entire face swiveling away from the rest of the artificial cranium. A minute violet alien, gravely injured but not entirely lifeless, totters up out of a tiny cockpit inside Galileo's head, with joysticks and display panels all around the inside of the cranium. The Zeptonian nods enthusiastically, nods again, collapses, and perishes. Leo and Max are not observing Clara when ZAP! Without even glancing at her, Leo whips out his illuminator and erases her memory.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: The LTD stops at Beatrice's farmhouse, where an alien ship landed. Jay and Kay, appearing as undercover cops, approach Beatrice, who looks better dressed and smiles. Inside, Jay sips lemonade while Kay analyzes scorched earth where the ship landed. Dr. Laurel Weaver, who previously spoke to Jay, examines Rosenberg's dissected body. She pets his cat and continues her examination despite Jay's disgust. Jay notices strange stitching around Rosenberg's ear and discovers a mechanical latch. He pulls it, revealing a small, wounded green man operating Rosenberg's mechanical skull. The alien nods before collapsing and dying. Without noticing Laurel, Kay flashes his neuralyzer, erasing her memory.
